content.description: Sit start, matched on a the arete with a heal hook. Bump up the arete using slopers and heel hooks. The crux: move across a thin crimp rail to a couple more slopers, smear your left foot on the face below (there's an almost non-existent nub that works if you can find it), and get your right foot higher up on the arete.  Use some pinches (if your hands are big enough) and rock over.
content.location: This is on the same boulder as Men in Tights.

content.description:
Sit start on a crimp (right) and a sidepull/rail thing (left), bump up the rail, and bring your right hand over. Shoot for the lip and top out. It is easier without the sit start. 

  This is a fun, little problem if you're in the area.
content.location:
From Louisa Lake, head down the bike trail until you get to a slight pulloff area with a rock that has "Keep Exercising" painted on it (can't miss it if you come in from Louisa lake. but not as obvious if you are coming in from the other direction). Go around the large, slab-like boulder to find the trail, and you come to another boulder with this problem on it (you can't really miss it). The problem is right on the front of it. 

  The "Keep Exercising" rock has been painted over white.

content.description: Robin Hood Boulder is a good boulder with some easy lines in it and a pretty good arete problem.
